courses.name: Elementary Classical Greek
courses.desc: An introduction to classical Greek. No knowledge of the language is assumed.

courses.name: Intermediate Classical and Biblical Greek
courses.desc: Selections from various ancient Greek authors chosen at the discretion of the Instructor. Prerequisite: AP/GK 1000 6.00 or equivalent or permission of director of classical studies.

courses.name: Socrates
courses.desc:
A careful study of Socrates, the man and the philosopher, in the dialogues of Plato and the writings of other classical Greek authors.
Prerequisite: AP/GK 2000 6.00 or permission of director of classical studies. Course credit exclusion: AP/GK 4050 3.00.

PRIOR TO FALL 2009: Prerequisite: AS/GK 2000 6.00 or permission of director of classical studies. Course credit exclusions: AS/GK 3050 3.00 and AS/GK 4050 3.00.

courses.name: Later Greek Prose
courses.desc:
This course introduces students to Greek prose of the Roman Imperial Period in the original Greek. In addition to the study of language and literary form, the course also considers the social and political context of the works. 
Prerequisite: AP/GK 2000 6.00 or permission of director of classical studies. Course credit exclusion: AP/GK 4080 3.00.

PRIOR TO FALL 2009: Prerequisite: AS/GK 2000 6.00 or permission of director of classical studies. Course credit exclusions: AS/GK 3080 3.00 and AS/GK 4080 3.00.
